summary.overall_findings: Procter & Gamble's public disclosures show operational practices in transparency and governance, with policy documents requiring suppliers to inform the company about their AI use and mandating due diligence on AI tools. All 7 evaluated pillars have documented public evidence, with fairness, explainability, oversight, privacy, and external accountability addressed at the policy level. Published materials further highlight an emphasis on human accountability for AI outputs and mention policies for addressing bias in training data. Additionally, policy documents restrict personal data input into generative AI without approval. This assessment draws on 22 publicly available sources.
